content.description:
Start with your hands on both sides of the arete. There will be good catches for each hand (left: sidepull/crimp, right: sloper with a catch). Get your left foot really low on a rock coming out of the ground and your right foot on the right side with little notches. Move up the arete on both sides until you catch a glorious, right hand sidepull. Move out left to a big dish, and continue up and left to top.

The rock quality varies on the left arete, be wary of breaking footholds. There aren't many foot holds, making you scramble for anything.
content.location: Starts on the thin, open spaced arete on the left side. Climbs the backside of the saddle.

content.description:
Start on the same holds as

Guns Blazing

. Instead of moving into the left sidepull, hit the arete, and continue up the right arete, since it provides better holds. Top out on some mossy bits (I tried cleaning it to the best without destroying the rock).
content.location:
Use the same start as

Guns Blazing

.
